description.plain:
Dequantes Lamar (born October 4, 1989), better known by his stage name Rich Homie Quan is a rapper from Atlanta, Georgia, currently signed to Motown and Cash Money Records; formerly to T.I.G. (Think It’s A Game) Entertainment.

RHQ is especially known for his hit songs “Flex” and “Type Of Way”. Also he has released some notable solo mixtapes and a very successful mixtape together with Birdman and Young Thug. He now releases mixtapes and EP’s independently.

body.plain:
Dequantes Lamar (born October 4, 1989), better known by his stage name Rich Homie Quan is a rapper from Atlanta, Georgia, currently signed to Motown and Cash Money Records; formerly to T.I.G. (Think It’s A Game) Entertainment.

RHQ is especially known for his hit songs “Flex” and “Type Of Way”. Also he has released some notable solo mixtapes and a very successful mixtape together with Birdman and Young Thug. He now releases mixtapes and EP’s independently.

songs.full_title: Type Of Way by Rich Homie Quan
songs.title: Type Of Way

description.plain:
Released on August 22, 2013, “Type Of Way” is the second single from Rich Homie Quan’s Still Goin In: Reloaded mixtape. While addressing the boyfriend of the girl he’s creeping with, Quan uses the term “type of way” to describe a range of complex emotions—from jealousy to sexual attraction.

The track became the track of the season for the Michigan State football team in 2013. They invited Quan to stand on the sidelines during their 2014 Rose Bowl victory, and had a dance party in their locker room to track after the game:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=biXaQk-TDJk

The track was produced by Yung Carter—making of the beat below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c7XlEau1Mis

songs.full_title: Flex (Ooh, Ooh, Ooh) by Rich Homie Quan
songs.title: Flex (Ooh, Ooh, Ooh)

description.plain:
This song is one of Quan’s first offerings without Young Thug since blowing up with “Type of Way” in August, 2013. It’s also his highest charting single as of summer 2015, reaching number 27 on the Billboard Hot 100.

Critics described the song as “his [Quan’s] Summer Single zenith” and that “the song can take a couple listens to fully absorb.”
